310670.description: Ripe aromas of honeydew, mango and slight banana show on the nose of this bottling, which retains its freshness deep into the sipping experience. There is a strong chalky grip to the sip, where ripe tropical flavors of papaya and coconut flake are cut by clean lines of citrus peel.
310670.title: Monochrome 2017 Plum Orchard Lane Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
310670.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
310670.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

310744.description: Steely in acidity, this white has a fleshy midpalate of apricot with floral underpinnings of jasmine and rose. A moderate body of texture is layered and refreshingly crisp.

310744.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

304993.description: Entirely fresh aromas of apple and honeydew rank as pure and inviting. On the palate, this is buffed and stony, like a good Rías Baixas Albariño should be. Nectarine and citrus flavors finish well on a long, effortless finish.

A plump palate is chunky due to barrel aging, while this tastes mostly of wood resin and related bitterness. While well made, this is what it is: a heavily oaked Albariño cut from its own mold.

307575.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US

307593.description: Tightly woven aromas of chalky mandarin zest and faint nectarine show on the fresh nose of this bottling by Rick Longoria. There is bright lemony flavor and crushed chalk minerality on the palate, and the acid just won't quit, even days after opening the bottle.

302965.description: Fresh while also creamy, this wine is full of ripe apple fruits cut with lemon zest. It is a young wine with rich potential and a strong texture. Let the forward fruitiness calm down and drink from 2019.
302965.title: Quinta de Paços 2017 Casa do Capitão-Mor Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
302965.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

302982.description: Lightly herbal, this crisp, cool wine is also rich with pear and melon flavors. The acidity and mineral edge give it an extra attractiveness. The wine is still a little young, so wait until mid-2019.

305971.title: Schmidt 2017 Albariño (Applegate Valley)
305971.location: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
305971.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.
Paul Gregutt is a Contributing Editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine, a founding member of the magazine’s Tasting Panel, and reviews the wines of Oregon and Canada. The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.

276033.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Other U.S.
Fiona Adams’ excitement for wine was sparked at a young age by her father. Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2014, Fiona hopes to share her passion for natural wines.
Email: fadams@wineenthusiast.net

296316.description: Attractively buttery in flavor and very creamy in texture, this medium- to full-bodied wine tastes like vanilla, butterscotch and honey, and feels smooth and almost thick on the palate. Not the usual tangy profile of the varietal, but it's done well in an über-rich style.

296316.location: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
296316.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. Schachner reviews more than 2,000 wines annually for WE and regularly travels to Chile, Argentina and Spain to keep abreast of the constantly changing global wine map.

300371.description: This wine comes from outside the heartland of Alvarinho, in southern Vinho Verde, hence the Minho appellation. It is rich and full of ripe fruits, with an open, tangy texture. Already deliciously fruity, the wine will be better from 2019.
300371.title: Quinta das Arcas 2017 Arca Nova Alvarinho (Minho)
300371.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

298557.description: Very light and clean aromas of lime balm, squeezed citrus, freshly cut apple and wet cement show on the nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard. Green-pear and sliced apple flavors are framed by a chalky grip and a racy acidity that's almost too powerful.
298557.title: Croma Vera 2017 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
298557.location: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
298557.taster_description:

A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

300136.description: Fruit for this wine comes from Dutchman Vineyard. The aromas pop, with notes of lemon rind and melon leading to lightly spritzy ale, pineapple-rind and melon flavors. It appears to need some additional time in bottle to settle in.
300136.title: The Orcas Project 2017 Dutchman Vineyard Albariño (Yakima Valley)
300136.location: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
300136.taster_description:

Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. 300461.description: Plenty of acidity reminds us that this grape's home is in the cool north of Portugal. A touch of richness and tropical fruit helps bring this wine south. It's attractive, balanced and ready to drink.

300549.title: Wines & Winemakers 2017 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoila Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

Wood aged and ripe with spice and smooth white fruits, the wine is intense and beautifully ripe. It should be aged a little longer to bring out its full character, so drink from early 2019.

That's the home of Alvarinho and the cool damp climate on granite soil suits this grape perfectly. Spicy, tangy and with a toasty edge from wood aging, the wine is intense, ripe and with a final tight, mineral texture and acidity. Drink now.

295551.taster_description:

295553.title: Anselmo Mendes 2017 Contacto Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

296112.title: Horton 2017 Private Release Albariño (Virginia)
296112.taster_description:
Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2015, Carrie’s love of wine and thirst for knowledge is immediately recognizable, and her superior organizational skills keeps our in-house tastings organized and efficient. When not putting flights together, she’s contributing content to the print magazine and Web site.
Email: cdykes@wineenthusiast.net

295103.description: From the Minho region in northern Portugal, the wine is ripe, with citrus and white-fruit flavors and is already ready to drink. Balanced between acidity and a more rounded texture, the wine is both fruity and generous. Drink now.

Light and bright flavors pop on the palate, from lemon rinds and grapefruit juice to rainy sidewalk, all wrapped in a very grippy texture.

295344.location: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
295344.taster_description:

Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

Its smooth palate has a full texture, bracing acidity and lightly salty apple flavors that finish with a briny note of seashell. Overall, this balances pop with weight, capturing what can be so appealing about Albariño.

Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. It feels mouthfilling and rich but has enough good acidity for liveliness and balance. Fine print on the label says this is made from Albariño, and it's a most unusual and enjoyable example of the Spanish varietal.

272427.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

265283.taster_description:
Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2015, Carrie’s love of wine and thirst for knowledge is immediately recognizable, and her superior organizational skills keeps our in-house tastings organized and efficient. When not putting flights together, she’s contributing content to the print magazine and Web site.
Email: cdykes@wineenthusiast.net

272640.location: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
272640.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.

The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.

Drink from late 2017.

255714.description: Melon and a green note of pole beans and lettuce set up a high-acid citric palate. Grassy notes of clover and lettuce infiltrate core citrus flavors, while this shows lemony punch and an herbal note on a juicy tangy finish.
255714.title: Castro Martin 2015 A2O Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)

244046.description: Aromas of dusty lees, grapefruit and pine needles set up a snappy citric palate. This tastes of pithy lime, lemon and orange, while a quick-fading finish mixes citrus-peel notes with a hint of grapes skins and pyrazines.

250989.description: This crisp, coastal wine was fermented in half concrete and half stainless steel. It blithely retains plenty of acidity amid its medium-bodied layers of quince, white peach, lemon, forest floor and a touch of dried herb.
250989.title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 Albariño (Sonoma Coast)
250989.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

254262.description: Vines over 20 years old are seen as old vines for this wine. A ripe wine, it is full of tropical fruits, with a dense texture and intense green-fruit acidity. Mineral with balanced fruit, it will be ready to drink from mid-2017.
254262.title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 QM Vinhas Velhas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
254262.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

252592.description: Citrus, mineral and honey aromas are good but not all that complex. This feels full and weighty, with nectarine and orange flavors. On the finish, dry citrus flavors are round and lasting but low on elegance. Drink now.
252592.title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2015 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)

249942.description: Yellow in color, with subdued aromas of apple and squash, this feels creamy and a touch flat. Baked and buttered apple flavors finish dry and salty. For oak-aged Albariño, this is well done. Drink now.
249942.title: Nora 2013 Nora da Neve Albariño (Rías Baixas)

243363.description: A yellowish color announces this oaked Albariño. Aromas of sunflower seeds and stone fruits are more mellow than loud. Creamy and full bodied, this benefits from bold malic acidity. Flavors of summer corn, dried apple and wood resin finish salty. Drink now with fish, crab or lobster.

252772.description: Fleshy oily aromas of orange peel and white flowers lead to a chunky, citric palate that's more full and blocky than elegant. Briny orange and tart nectarine flavors finish plump.
252772.title: Fillaboa 2015 Estate Grown/Viñedo Propio Albariño (Rías Baixas)

242124.description: Aromas of green melon and pear are calm like a lake with no breeze. This feels mildly creamy, while leesy briny melon and peach flavors turn somewhat bitter prior to a soft easy finish that doesn't sing but doesn't fall off.
242124.title: Pazo de Barrantes 2013 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)

254212.description: A year after harvest, this ripe wine is showing the creamy side of Alvarinho. It hasn't lost its bright fruit, giving lemon as well as light toast from wood aging. Drink this wine now.
254212.title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)

244364.description: Tropical fruit, banana and citrus aromas are flat and not fully convincing. This is narrow in feel, with bland stone-fruit flavors. The finish follows the palate, meaning it's good enough but unremarkable.
244364.title: Val do Sosego 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

248105.description: Lemon and apple aromas precede a high-acid citric palate without much elegance or finesse. This pedestrian Albariño deals pithy orange flavors that come with a note of grape skins. On the finish, this seems like orange juice.

252627.description: Oxidized apricot aromas comprise the bulk of the nose on this weird oak-aged Albariño. Flavors of apricot, peach pit and quince quickly turn bitter, while the finish is flabby. Overall this is sketchy, with few attributes.

250220.description: Fresh yellow pear, yellow grapefruit and wet river-stone aromas leap from the glass on this fresh and crisp bottling from a winery led by longtime grape grower Bill Kesselring. It's very textural on the tingling palate, where the vibrant mix of acid and tannins reveal sweet then tangy apple flavors before settling into a lime and lemon-rind groove.
250220.title: Peloton 2015 Spanish Springs Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo)
250220.location: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
250220.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

250192.description: Made in barrels that have acacia wood on the heads, this bottling initially shows aromatic lemongrass and cut-grass greenness before offering riper peach, pear and almond oil on the nose. It tightens up on the sip, where tart apple skins, green pear and light honeysuckle flavors arise.
250192.title: Brecon Estate 2015 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
250192.location: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US

244503.description: Jasmine and orange blossom dot the nose of this nicely made wine, a variety not often found in California. Apple rind defines the crisp, mineral-laden experience, focused and clear in its rocky texture of wet stone.
244503.title: Artesa 2015 Albariño (Carneros)

250191.description: Intensely plush aromas of peach, daffodil, sweet rose and even pineapple show on the nose of this botting. There's lots of sizzle to the racy sip, where tart green apple, green pear and green-tomato flavors make for a tangy, refreshing wine.
